Title.evidence: Impact of Mechanical Bowel Preparation on Gut Microbiome and Postoperative Infections: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This open-label, two-arm pilot RCT was conducted at the National Cancer Institute, Vilnius, Lithuania.

Participants.evidence: Patients with left-sided colorectal cancer scheduled for elective resection were randomized 1:1 to receive either OP or RE.

Intervention.evidence: Patients with left-sided colorectal cancer scheduled for elective resection were randomized 1:1 to receive either OP or RE.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effects of oral preparation (OP) and rectal enema (RE) on these outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in β-diversity of the gut microbiome on postoperative day (POD) 6.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed opaque envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the nature of the interventions.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty participants were randomized between April and November 2021, with 20 allocated to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Two patients in the OP group were excluded from analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference in β-diversity was observed on POD6 (p=0.198).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to MBP were reported.
